select t.type_code as type_code, bat.type_name as type_name, t.type_level as type_level, t.type_count as type_count FROM( select type1 as type_code, 1 as type_level, count(*) as type_count from t_case_report where org_full_path like CONCAT(#{orgFullPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in
#{item} AND ymd >=#{beginYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and chour >=#{beginHour,jdbcType=INTEGER} and chour <=#{endHour,jdbcType=INTEGER} group by type1 UNION select type2 as type_code, 2 as type_level, count(*) as type_count from t_case_report where org_full_path like CONCAT(#{orgFullPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in
#{item} AND ymd >=#{beginYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and chour >=#{beginHour,jdbcType=INTEGER} and chour <=#{endHour,jdbcType=INTEGER} group by type2 )as t left join b_alarm_type as bat on t.type_code=bat.TYPE_CODE where t.type_code is not NULL
